revised_title: Manufacturing Technology in the 1980s: Component Manufacture and Joining Techniques
tldr: This article discusses the manufacturing technology of the 1980s, focusing on component manufacture and joining techniques. It compares machining, forging, and casting methods, highlighting the advantages and disadvantages of each. The author emphasizes the need for improvements in die-making technology to fully exploit the potential of casting and forging processes. The article also explores the use of molybdenum alloys in die materials and the benefits of pressure die casting for mass production of accurate components.
